intro: Clidemia pycnaster subsp. robusta, commonly known as the robust clidemia, is a tropical shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate to elliptical leaves that are typically covered in a fine, pubescent layer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Clidemia pycnaster subsp. robusta is known for its rapid growth and ability to form thickets, making it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
